fr.sii.ogham.email.sendgrid.v4.sender.impl.sendgrid.handler

Class MultiContentHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sii.ogham.email.sendgrid.v4.sender.impl.sendgrid.handler.MultiContentHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SendGridContentHandler

    public final class MultiContentHandler
extends Object
implements SendGridContentHandler
    Content handler for MultiContent instances. All it does is, for each content contained within the instance, it delegates processing to an injected content handler.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MultiContentHandler(SendGridContentHandler delegate)
      Constructor.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void setContent(Email original, MailCompat email, Content content)
      Reads the content and adds it into the email.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • MultiContentHandler

        public MultiContentHandler(SendGridContentHandler delegate)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        delegate - the underlying content handler to delegate processing of each of the contents contained within a MultiContent instance

    • Method Detail

      • setContent

        public void setContent(Email original,
                       MailCompat email,
                       Content content)
                throws ContentHandlerException
        Reads the content and adds it into the email. This method is expected to update the content of the email parameter. While the method signature accepts any Content instance as parameter, the method will fail if anything other than a MultiContent is provided.
        Specified by:
        setContent in interface SendGridContentHandler
        Parameters:
        original - the original Ogham email
        email - the email to put the content in
        content - the unprocessed content
        Throws:
        ContentHandlerException - the handler is unable to add the content to the email
        IllegalArgumentException - the content provided is not of the right type
